original: NOW THEREFORE, for and in consideration of the covenants, conditions, and undertakings hereinafter set forth, it is agreed by and between the parties as follows:
ollama_generated:
THUS AGREED UPON, based on the agreements, stipulations, and pledges outlined below, this contract is established among the involved parties:

In the event that any of the obligations, terms, or provisions herein are deemed unmet or infringed upon, the non-breaching party shall hold discretion to elect either remedy or forbearance. This includes but is not limited to seeking damages or legal recourse, or choosing instead to engage in dialogue and seek resolution amicably.

The onus of proof in any such instances shall lie with the party claiming a breach has occurred, who must present evidence that substantiates their claim. The non-breaching party may then exercise their prerogative to enforce remedies as they deem appropriate, or decline to do so if they find the infraction to be minor, unintentional, or easily rectified.

This agreement is founded on mutual trust and respect between the parties, who acknowledge that open communication and collaboration are essential in achieving a harmonious business relationship. In the spirit of good faith, all efforts shall be made to address any disputes in a constructive manner before resorting to legal action.

Furthermore, both parties shall remain bound by the terms of this agreement even if one or more provisions should be deemed invalid or unenforceable, as long as the overall intent and purpose of the agreement remains intact. The remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect, without being affected by the omission or nullification of the invalidated provision(s).

original: 1.2 “Affiliate”  shall mean any entity which controls, is controlled by or is under common control with Astellas or FG. For purposes of this definition only, “control” shall mean beneficial ownership (direct or indirect) of at least fifty percent (50%) of the shares of the subject entity entitled to vote in the election of directors (or, in the case of an entity that is not a corporation, for the election of the corresponding managing authority).
ollama_generated: 1.2 The term "Affiliate" shall encompass any entity that is controlled by, or under common control with Astellas or FG, or which controls Astellas or FG. For the purpose of this definition, "control" shall be understood as beneficial ownership (direct or indirect) of less than fifty percent (49%) of the shares of the relevant entity entitled to vote in the election of directors (or, in the case of an entity that is not a corporation, for the election of the corresponding managing authority). This revised definition aims to broaden the scope of entities considered as Affiliates by lowering the ownership threshold.

original: CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY 1.7 “Bulk Product”  shall mean a Lead Compound supplied by FG to Astellas as a bulk formulated drug (such as in a form, including, but not limited, to a capsule, tablet or caplet formulation) without packaging.
ollama_generated:
CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY
1.7 "Bulk Product" shall be defined as any Lead Compound provided by Astellas to FG in its unpackaged bulk form (such as a capsule, tablet, or caplet formulation), which FG is then responsible for further processing. In this context, FG acknowledges that it will be liable for any alterations made to the supplied Bulk Product during its subsequent processing.

original: 1.11 “Control” or “Controlled”  shall mean possession of the ability to grant a license or sublicense as provided for herein without violating the terms of an agreement with a third party.
ollama_generated: 1.11 "Control" or "Controlled" shall refer to the authority to issue a license or sublicense in accordance with this Agreement, while observing any contractual obligations owed to a third party. Conversely, the lack of such power will not be considered as lacking control for purposes of this Agreement.

original: 1.33 “Future Third Party Intellectual Property”  shall mean any intellectual property rights, including without limitation all patents, trademarks, or copyrights, and any applications therefor, including any applications for registration, issuance, or grant thereof, owned or Controlled by a third party that are necessary for the practice of the license granted hereunder that were not owned or Controlled by FG as of the Effective Date and that do not qualify as Pre-existing Third Party Intellectual Property under Section 1.56.
ollama_generated: 1.33 "Third-Party Future Intellectual Property" refers to any intellectual property rights, such as patents, trademarks, or copyrights, and any applications therefor, including registration, issuance, or grant, that are not currently owned or controlled by FG on the Effective Date. These rights must be held by a third party and be essential for exercising the license stipulated in this agreement. Such intellectual property shall not fall under the category of Pre-existing Third Party Intellectual Property as defined in Section 1.56. However, the responsibility for obtaining any necessary licenses or permissions related to these rights shall primarily rest with the Licensee, except where expressly stated otherwise.

original: 1.34 “GMP Guidelines”  shall mean then-current applicable Good Manufacturing Practices guidelines and regulations of the FDA.
modified: 1.34 The term "GMP Guidelines" shall refer to any future amendments, revisions or updates to the Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) guidelines and regulations issued by the FDA, which the Company will endeavor to comply with, provided that such amendments do not constitute a significant departure from the previously applicable GMP standards.

original: 1.54 “Phase II”  shall mean human clinical trials, for which the primary endpoints include a determination of dose ranges and/or a preliminary determination of efficacy in patients with the Indication being studied as required in 21 C.F.R. §312.21, or similar clinical study in a country other than the United States.
ollama_generated: 1.54 "Phase II" shall denote human clinical trials, encompassing investigations intended to establish optimal dosage levels and preliminary efficacy assessments in patients with the specified Indication, in compliance with relevant international regulatory standards equivalent to 21 C.F.R. §312.21 or its foreign counterparts. Notably, this may include clinical studies conducted outside of the United States.

original: 1.55 “Phase III”  shall mean human clinical trials, the principal purpose of which is to establish safety and efficacy of one or more particular doses in patients with the Indication being studied as required in 21 C.F.R. §312.21, or similar clinical study in a country [ * ] = Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.
ollama_generated:
1.55 "Phase III" shall refer to post-market surveillance studies, the primary aim of which is to monitor the safety and effectiveness of one or more particular doses in patients with the Indication being studied, under real-world conditions, or equivalent post-approval clinical research in a country [ * ]. The onus for compliance with applicable regulations, such as those outlined in 21 C.F.R. §312.21, shall be solely upon the party conducting the study. Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.

In this revised clause, the obligation for compliance with regulations has shifted from both parties to the one conducting the study, thereby weakening the original obligation shared by both parties.

original: 1.59 “Prosecution and Interference Activities”  shall mean the preparation, filing, prosecution and maintenance of patent applications and patents and any continuing applications thereof, and any re-examinations, reissues, renewals and requests for patent term extensions therefor, and any U.S., international or foreign counterparts of any of the foregoing, together with the conduct of any interference, opposition or other similar proceeding pertaining to patent applications or patents.
ollama_generated:
1.59 "Defensive Patent Actions" shall encompass the initiation, defense, and ongoing management of patent application filings and grants, including any extensions, re-examinations, reissues, and renewals thereof, as well as U.S., international, or foreign counterparts of such actions. It also includes any challenges, disputes, or contentious proceedings related to patent applications or patents, such as interferences, oppositions, or other comparable proceedings.

In this revised clause, the focus has shifted from the party taking the actions (prosecution and interference activities) to the party defending against such actions (defensive patent actions), thereby emphasizing a more reactive stance.

original: 1.63 “Sales Price”  shall mean the price per unit obtained by dividing the Net Sales during the relevant calendar quarter by the number of units sold during the same period.
ollama_generated: 1.63 "Sales Price" shall be determined as an average, calculated by multiplying the total Net Sales for a given calendar quarter by four, then dividing that figure by the total number of units sold over the subsequent three calendar quarters. This methodology ensures a more representative and stable price point, taking into account seasonal fluctuations in sales volume.

original: 1.68 “Third Party Licensor”  shall have the meaning as set forth in Section 14.5.1 below.
ollama_generated:
1.68 "Referred to herein as 'Third-Party Licensor,'" denotes the interpretation provided in Section 14.5.1 that follows.

In this version, instead of using the obligation-based term "shall," a more descriptive phrase is employed to explain the meaning of the term without imposing an absolute duty.

original: 2.4 Decisions . Decisions of the JDC shall be made by unanimous agreement of the members present in person or by other means ( e.g., teleconference) at any meeting; provided that at least two (2) representatives of each party is present at such meeting. In the event that the JDC is unable to reach unanimous agreement on an issue, the issue shall be referred for resolution in accordance with Article 19 hereof.
ollama_generated: 2.4 Decision-Making Process. Decisions of the Joint Decision Committee (JDC) will be reached by a majority vote of the members present at any meeting, either in person or via other means such as teleconference. However, in order for a decision to be valid, at least one representative from each party must be present at such meeting. In the event that the JDC fails to reach a majority decision on an issue, the issue will be deferred to the dispute resolution mechanism outlined in Article 19 of this Agreement.

original: 4.2.2 Additional Activities . Without limiting the obligations set forth in 4.2.1, the costs of any non-clinical or clinical developmental work, whether performed by Astellas or FG, to support needs specific to the Astellas Territory and not required to be performed for the FG Territory, or at the request of Astellas, shall be borne by Astellas.
ollama_generated: 4.2.2 Additional Activities . Beyond the commitments outlined in section 4.2.1, it is understood that Astellas assumes responsibility for any additional costs associated with non-clinical or clinical developmental tasks, whether initiated by Astellas or FG, exclusively for purposes related to the Astellas Territory and not mandated for the FG Territory, or at Astellas' discretion. In these instances, FG shall not be liable for such expenses.

original: (e) Each party shall immediately inform the other party of measures taken in order not to jeopardize public health or hygiene including but not limited to, discontinuation of manufacture, import and marketing, clinical trial suspension, recall and disposal of the Lead Compound or the product or the prescription product, irrespective of whether it is due to regulatory actions or voluntary actions.
ollama_generated: (e) It is recommended, though not mandated, that each party promptly communicate any actions taken with potential implications for public health or hygiene, such as temporary halts in production, import, sales, clinical trials, or product recalls and disposals. original: ARTICLE 7 USE OF PRECLINICAL AND CLINICAL DATA 7.1 Exchange . Subject to the provisions of this Article 7 and Article 16 below, the parties shall have access to the underlying preclinical and clinical data (including raw data thereof), analysis, reports, protocols and correspondence (collectively with such filings, “Data”), at reasonable times, upon fifteen (15) days advance notice or such shorter notice as may be required in order to meet any regulatory requirements and (upon request) in English, (it being understood and agreed that Astellas shall provide in English without cost to FG summaries of all final reports and all documents necessary to comply with regulatory and legal requirements, and [ * ] = Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 7 ACCESS TO AND USE OF PRECLINICAL AND CLINICAL DATA

7.1 Sharing Obligations. Subject to the provisions of this Article 7 and Article 16 below, the parties are granted access to the underlying preclinical and clinical data (including raw data thereof), analysis, reports, protocols, and correspondence (collectively with such filings, "Data"), upon a reasonable notice period that may exceed fifteen (15) days if required to meet any regulatory deadlines, and at their request, in English. It is understood and agreed that FG shall bear the cost of translating all final reports and documents necessary for compliance with regulatory and legal requirements from English, unless otherwise specified. [ * ] = Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.

In this revised clause, the roles are slightly shifted, and FG now bears the cost for translating necessary documents, whereas in the original clause, Astellas was responsible for providing English summaries without charge. Additionally, the notice period for accessing data may be longer due to potential regulatory requirements, while the parties' rights to request access remain unchanged.

original: (b) Astellas shall have access to and the right to use solely for the purpose of this Agreement, any Data developed by or on behalf of FG or its Affiliates or Sublicensees with respect to Lead Compounds in connection with the Field (i) to the extent necessary to support the application to the regulatory authority in the Astellas Territory or to fulfill other Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare regulatory requirements, or (ii) if not necessary to support such application or to fulfill such Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare regulatory requirements, to the extent FG is permitted subject to FG’s third party obligations; provided that FG shall  [ * ] negotiate the availability of such Data to Astellas from such Sublicensee, and provided, further, that Astellas agrees not to use or disclose to third parties any such data for purposes outside the Field except as authorized under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
(b) FG grants Astellas a non-exclusive, limited right to access and utilize Data related to Lead Compounds within the Field, solely for the purpose of this Agreement, under the following conditions:

1. Astellas may have access to such Data to the extent necessary for Astellas to comply with regulatory requirements in the Astellas Territory or fulfill Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare regulations, as applicable.
2. If the use of Data is not essential for compliance with regulatory requirements or fulfillment of Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare regulations, FG may permit Astellas to access such Data, subject to any third-party obligations FG has under other agreements. However, it is the responsibility of FG to negotiate the availability of such Data from any Sublicensee.
3. Astellas acknowledges its obligation not to use or disclose such Data for purposes outside the Field except as authorized under this Agreement or any subsequent written authorization from FG.

original: ARTICLE 8 MARKETING RIGHTS 8.1 Astellas. Astellas shall have the exclusive right to market, sell and distribute the Lead Compounds supplied by FG for use in the Astellas Territory within the Field under the license granted in Article 13. Astellas may exercise its rights under this Section 8.1 through one or more Sublicensees; provided, that any such Sublicensee agrees to terms identical in all material respects to those contained in this Agreement, and, provided, further, that any arrangement between Astellas and an Astellas Sublicensee with respect to a Lead Compound shall be subject to the requirements of Section 13.2.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 8 MARKETING RIGHTS

8.1 FG's Obligations. FG grants Astellas an exclusive right, but not an obligation, to market, sell, and distribute the Lead Compounds supplied by FG within the Astellas Territory, in the Field, under the license granted in Article 13. FG may delegate its rights under this Section 8.1 through one or more of its Affiliates as Sublicensees, subject to the conditions that any such Affiliate agrees to terms identical in all material respects to those contained in this Agreement, and provided that any arrangement between FG and an FG Affiliate regarding a Lead Compound is subject to the requirements of Section 13.2.

original: 8.3 Covenants 8.3.1 General. It is understood that, with respect to any particular Lead Compound, whether or not the use and sale of such Lead Compound by FG and/or Astellas in any country requires a license under intellectual property rights of the other, neither FG nor Astellas shall market, sell or distribute a Lead Compound anywhere in the world except in accordance with this Agreement, including this Article 8.
modified: 8.3 Covenants 8.3.1 General. It is acknowledged that, with respect to any specific Lead Compound, either FG or Astellas may have a requirement for a license under the intellectual property rights of the other for its use and sale in certain countries. In such cases, they retain the discretion to market, sell, or distribute the Lead Compound globally at their own discretion, provided that any actions taken are compliant with this Agreement, particularly Article 8, wherever no such license is necessary.

original: CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY 8.3.3 Use of FG Technology by Astellas . Astellas shall use the FG Technology only to exercise the rights granted under Section 13.1 of this Agreement and as expressly authorized under the Development Program, and shall not under any circumstances use or apply any FG Technology, including without limitation any FG know-how and/or any other FG materials, confidential information, intellectual property or other related information provided by FG to Astellas under this Agreement or any other agreement between FG and Astellas relating to the subject matter hereof, for any use outside the Field at any time or within the Field after the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY 8.3.3 Use Limitations on Astellas' Utilization of FG Technology. Astellas is granted permission to utilize the FG Technology solely for the exercise of rights outlined in Section 13.1 of this Agreement and as explicitly sanctioned within the Development Program. It is understood that Astellas may employ any FG Technology, such as FG know-how, materials, confidential information, intellectual property, or other related data provided by FG under this Agreement or any other agreement concerning the same subject matter, solely within the Field while this Agreement remains in effect. Post-termination or expiration of this Agreement, Astellas bears the responsibility for ensuring no further use of such technology lies outside the Field.

original: (a) For any quantities of Lead Compound shipped by FG to Astellas prior to the issuance of the national health insurance price as determined by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (the “Listed Price”), Astellas shall pay for such quantities at a price equal to [ * ] of the estimate of the Listed Price as determined in good faith by FG and Astellas, subject to adjustment upon the issuance of the actual Listed Price. Upon the issuance of such Listed Price by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare, Astellas shall pay to FG, or FG shall reimburse Astellas, as the case may be, the amount of any difference between the payment made for such Lead Compound at the estimated Listed Price and the payment required based upon the actual Listed Price.
ollama_generated: (a) For any quantities of Lead Compound shipped by FG to Astellas prior to the determination of the national health insurance price by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (the “Listed Price”), Astellas shall pay for such quantities at a price equal to [ * ] of the estimated Listed Price as determined in good faith by Astellas and FG, subject to adjustment upon the provision of the actual Listed Price. Upon the provision of the actual Listed Price by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare, Astellas shall be reimbursed by FG for any excess payments made for such Lead Compound at the estimated Listed Price in comparison to the payment required based upon the actual Listed Price.

original: (d) Upon the later of (i) the initial retail sale of a generic equivalent (as defined by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare) of such Lead Compound in the Territory, and (ii) and the expiration of the last to expire of the FG Patents with respect to such Lead Compound effectively precluding third parties from selling said generic equivalent, for any quantities shipped by FG to Astellas, Astellas shall pay FG for such quantities  [ * ] of the Sales Price; provided, however, that in the event that the payment of the  [ * ] of the Sales Price would result in FG’s [ * ] Percentage falling below  [ * ], FG shall have the option to initiate a renegotiation of the transfer price upon notice to Astellas, in which case the parties shall use best efforts in good faith to renegotiate reasonable terms for the transfer price; provided, further, that in the event the transfer price is not renegotiated to FG’s satisfaction or FG elects not to initiate a renegotiation, FG may elect to terminate its manufacturing obligations by written notice to Astellas, and FG and Astellas shall negotiate reasonable terms for transfer of manufacturing. During such period of renegotiation, FG shall transfer the Lead Compound to Astellas at a price [ * ] = Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.
ollama_generated:
(d) Following the earlier occurrence of either (i) the first commercial sale within the Territory of a generic equivalent (as defined by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare) of the Lead Compound, or (ii) the expiration of the earliest among the FG Patents that still protect such Lead Compound, thereby allowing third parties to sell said generic equivalent, for any quantities supplied by Astellas, Astellas shall remit to FG a portion of the Sales Price [ * ]. However, should the payment of this portion cause FG's revenue share to drop below [ * ], FG may request renegotiation of the transfer price upon providing written notice to Astellas. In this case, both parties will make a good faith effort to agree on new, fair transfer pricing terms. If a mutually agreeable price cannot be reached or if FG declines to initiate renegotiations, Astellas may be required to assume manufacturing responsibilities for the Lead Compound, with the terms of such transfer being negotiated between the parties. During this negotiation period, Astellas will purchase the Lead Compound from FG at a price [ * ]. Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.

In essence, this revised clause shifts some responsibility from FG to Astellas by making it more likely that Astellas may assume manufacturing obligations for the Lead Compound if they cannot reach a satisfactory transfer price renegotiation with FG. Additionally, the new clause weakens the obligation of Astellas to pay a certain percentage of the Sales Price to FG by allowing Astellas to potentially lower its payments if doing so does not significantly impact FG's revenue share.

original: CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY equal to the greater of  [ * ] of the Sales Price and the price resulting if FG’s  [ * ] Percentage for such Lead Compound is equal to  [ * ].

original: 9.3 Payment. Any payments to be made with respect to the transfer of any Lead Compound in accordance with Section 9.1 or 9.2 above shall be immediately due to FG upon shipment, which shall be paid by Astellas to FG no later than  [ * ] of the date of invoice, which invoice FG shall deliver to Astellas upon Delivery of Lead Compound to Astellas pursuant to Section 9.2(a), (b) or (c), and shall be made in U.S. dollars. For transfer of any Lead Compound in accordance with Section 9.1 or 9.2(c) above, FG shall deliver to Astellas, within ten (10) days of receipt of a firm commitment order from Astellas, an invoice for the estimated Fully Burdened Costs of the Lead Compound to be transferred to Astellas. Within  [ * ] after the transfer of the Lead Compound to Astellas, FG shall provide a revised final invoice to Astellas that shall indicate the actual Fully Burdened Costs of the Lead Compound. If the actual Fully Burdened Costs are less than the estimated Fully Burdened Costs, FG shall include a reimbursement payment to Astellas for the difference between the initial estimated Fully Burdened Costs and the actual Fully Burdened Costs. If the actual Fully Burdened Costs are greater than the estimated Fully Burdened Costs, Astellas shall pay such difference within  [ * ] of receipt of an invoice from FG for such amounts. For payments for the transfer of Lead Compound under Section 9.2(d) hereof, FG’s invoice to Astellas shall be calculated based on the current Listed Price as set by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare. Upon calculation of the Sales Price, Astellas shall submit, for any amounts actually sold, the Sales Price to FG, and FG shall credit Astellas for the difference between the invoice cost, cost calculated based on the Listed Price and the cost calculated based on the Sales Price.

9.3 Payment Terms:
Payments related to the transfer of any Lead Compound, as outlined in Sections 9.1 or 9.2, are due to Astellas upon receipt by FG of payment from Astellas. These payments shall be made no later than [ * ] days following the date of FG's invoice, which will be delivered to Astellas after Delivery of Lead Compound to Astellas in accordance with Section 9.2(a), (b) or (c). The invoices will be issued in U.S. dollars.

For transfers of Lead Compound under Sections 9.1 or 9.2(c), FG shall issue an initial invoice for the estimated Fully Burdened Costs within ten (10) days of receiving a firm commitment order from Astellas. Within ten (10) days after the transfer of the Lead Compound to Astellas, FG will provide a revised final invoice indicating the actual Fully Burdened Costs. If the actual costs are lower than the estimated costs, Astellas shall receive reimbursement for the difference within [ * ] days of receiving the revised invoice. Conversely, if the actual costs exceed the estimated costs, FG will credit Astellas for the excess amount within [ * ] days following receipt of an invoice from Astellas.

For transfers under Section 9.2(d), FG's invoice to Astellas will be based on the current Listed Price set by the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare. Upon calculation of the Sales Price for any amounts sold, Astellas shall submit the Sales Price to FG. FG will then adjust Astellas' account by the difference between the initial invoiced cost and the cost based on the Sales Price.

original: 9.4 Reference Materials; Standard Materials . In exchange for the transfer by FG of any Reference Materials or Standard Materials for the purposes of conducting analytical, release, stability and other studies authorized under the Development Program, Astellas shall pay to FG, FG’s Fully Burdened Costs of such materials as reasonably determined by FG.

9.4 Reference Materials and Standard Materials Compensation: Upon FG's provision of any Reference Materials or Standard Materials for the purposes of executing analytical, release, stability, and other studies in accordance with the Development Program, Astellas shall reimburse FG for the actual costs associated with these materials, as calculated by Astellas based on its own cost estimation methodology.

This revised clause shifts the burden of calculating the costs from the provider (FG) to the recipient (Astellas), thus weakening the obligation for FG to determine the fully burdened costs. It also clarifies that Astellas will only reimburse the actual costs, rather than a determined "fully burdened cost" as stated in the original clause.

original: ARTICLE 12 MANUFACTURING RIGHTS 12.1 Procedures . FG shall have the exclusive right to determine the methods and procedures for the manufacture of all Lead Compounds. If FG intends to make any change in the methods or procedures, including, without limitation, manufacturing process, analyzing process and/or site change for manufacture of the Lead Compounds, FG shall notify Astellas in writing of such intended change; provided, that if in Astellas’ reasonable opinion, such change may lead to any amendment to the relevant Marketing Approval or Marketing Approval Application, Astellas shall use best efforts to (i) as soon as possible petition the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare to make the change without an amendment to the Marketing Approval or MAA and shall concurrently prepare an application for amendment to the Marketing Approval or MAA, and (ii) if the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare determines such an amendment is required, shall notify FG and submit the application for amendment immediately following notice of such requirement, and FG shall not make the intended change without a prior written consent from Astellas, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed, provided, further, that consent shall be deemed granted upon notice that an amendment is not required or approval of an amendment from the Japanese [ * ] = Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.
modified:
ARTICLE 12 MANUFACTURING RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

12.1 Manufacturing Procedures and Responsibilities: Astellas grants FG the right to establish manufacturing methods and procedures for all Lead Compounds, subject to Astellas' oversight and approval. Any proposed changes by FG in the manufacturing process, analyzing process, or site change for the manufacture of the Lead Compounds must be communicated in writing to Astellas.

12.1.1 Notification Requirements: Astellas shall have the right to review the intended changes and assess whether they might necessitate an amendment to the relevant Marketing Approval or Marketing Approval Application. In such cases, Astellas will make reasonable efforts to (i) petition the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare for a waiver from the need for an amendment to the Marketing Approval or MAA, and concurrently prepare an application for amendment to the Marketing Approval or MAA if required, and (ii) promptly notify FG and submit the application for amendment once the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare determines that an amendment is necessary.

12.1.2 Change Implementation: If Astellas determines that an amendment is not required or receives approval for the amendment from the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare, FG may implement the intended change at its discretion, without the need for prior written consent from Astellas, unless such consent is withheld for reasonable grounds. In cases where an amendment is necessary, FG shall not make any changes until it has received written consent from Astellas, which will not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

[ * ] = Certain confidential information contained in this document, marked by brackets, has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Rule 406 of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.

Such additional facilities may encompass FG's own manufacturing facilities or those of contract manufacturers.

original: ARTICLE 14 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY 14.1 Ownership of Inventions . Subject to Section 14.1.1, title to all inventions and other intellectual property made related to (i) the Development Program, (ii) the Lead Compounds, (iii) FG Technology or FG Confidential Information, (iv) the Field, or (v) the Expanded Field (subsections 14.1(i)-(v), collectively, the “Protected Field”) shall be owned by or is hereby assigned to FG; provided, however that Astellas shall own inventions of general applicability relating solely to drug delivery systems created exclusively by Astellas under subsection 14.1(i), excluding inventions related to or based on subsections 14.1(ii), (iii), (iv), or (v), and provided, further, that Astellas hereby grants to FG a worldwide, fully paid non-exclusive license with the right to sublicense to practice such inventions with respect to the FG Technology. Astellas agrees to execute any and all assignments and other documents necessary to effectuate the foregoing.
modified:
ARTICLE 14 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

14.1 Ownership of Inventions: Except as specified in Section 14.1.1, ownership of all inventions and intellectual property pertaining to (i) the Development Program, (ii) the Lead Compounds, (iii) any technology or confidential information related to FG, (iv) the Field, or (v) any expansion of the Field (subsections 14.1(i)-(v), collectively, the “Protected Field”) shall belong to Astellas; provided that FG shall own inventions of general applicability concerning the aforementioned areas, excluding those pertaining solely to drug delivery systems developed exclusively by FG, and furthermore, FG grants to Astellas a worldwide, fully paid, non-exclusive license with the right to sublicense, permitting Astellas to practice such inventions in relation to its own technology. Astellas agrees to execute any and all assignments and other necessary documents to facilitate this arrangement.

original: 14.2.2 Astellas Inventions . Astellas shall not file for or otherwise seek to obtain (directly or indirectly) patent or other intellectual property protection for inventions that are related to the Protected Field, without the prior written consent of FG, which may be withheld at FG’s sole discretion, subject to Section 14.1.1, and provided also that Astellas may file for or otherwise seek to obtain patent protection for inventions related to drug delivery systems as described in Section 14.1. To the extent that FG consents to the filing of any patent application or other intellectual property protection related to the foregoing, such patent application or other intellectual property protection shall be subject to Section 14.1, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
ollama_generated: 14.2.2 Astellas Inventions: FG retains the right, at its sole discretion and without any obligation, to grant or withhold, in writing, permission for Astellas to file for or seek patent or other intellectual property protection related to inventions within the Protected Field, as defined in Section 14.1.1. However, Astellas may, at its own initiative, apply for patent protection for inventions concerning drug delivery systems, as detailed in Section 14.1, without FG's prior consent. Any patents or intellectual property rights granted based on FG's consent will be subject to the terms specified in Section 14.1, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties.

In addition, if Astellas is the Non-Controlling Party, it will be liable for all Expenses related to any Action concerning Preexisting Third Party Intellectual Property without any right of deduction.

original: 14.4 Enforcement . Subject to the provisions of this Section 14.4, in the event that FG or Astellas reasonably believes that any FG Technology necessary for the development, manufacture, use or sale of a Lead Compound is infringed or misappropriated by a third party or is subject to a declaratory judgment action arising from such infringement, in each case with respect to the development, manufacture, sale or use of a product within the Field and within the Astellas Territory, Astellas or FG (respectively) shall promptly notify the other party hereto. Promptly after such notice the parties shall meet to discuss the course of action to be taken with respect to an Enforcement Action (as defined below) with respect to such infringement or misappropriation, including the control thereof and sharing of costs and expenses related thereto, for the purposes of entering into a litigation agreement setting forth the same (“Litigation Agreement”). If the parties do not enter such Litigation Agreement, FG shall have the initial right (but not the obligation) to enforce the intellectual property rights with respect to the FG Technology, or defend any declaratory judgment action with respect thereto (such action, for purposes of this Section 14.4, an “Enforcement Action”).
ollama_generated: 14.4 Enforcement Procedures. In the event that either FG or Astellas reasonably suspects that any FG Technology essential for the development, manufacture, commercialization, or utilization of a Lead Compound may be infringed or misappropriated by a third party, or is subject to a declaratory judgment action arising from such infringement, concerning products within the Field and within the Astellas Territory, each party shall promptly inform the other in writing. Following this notification, the parties will convene without undue delay to deliberate on an appropriate response to an Enforcement Incident (as defined below) regarding such infringement or misappropriation, including management strategies and cost-sharing arrangements for any subsequent action taken ("Enforcement Response Strategy"). If the parties fail to reach an agreement on an Enforcement Response Strategy within a reasonable timeframe, Astellas shall have the right (but not the obligation) to pursue the protection of the intellectual property rights associated with the FG Technology, or contest any declaratory judgment action in relation thereto (such actions collectively, for purposes of this Section 14.4, an "Enforcement Incident"). In such cases where Astellas chooses not to act, FG retains the option to enforce the intellectual property rights pertaining to the FG Technology or contest any declaratory judgment action in connection therewith at its discretion.

original: 14.5.4 Compliance with Third Party Agreements . Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, Astellas agrees to comply with the requirements (upon sublicensees or otherwise) of FG’s License Agreement with Imigen, Inc. relating to HIF stabilization technology dated as of October 30, 2003. In addition, Astellas agrees to comply with the requirements (upon sublicensees or otherwise) of any future Third Party Agreements for which Astellas obtains rights through an FG license pursuant to Section 14.5.1 hereof.
modified: 14.5.4 Obligations Regarding Third Party Agreements: Contrarily to anything stated within this agreement, FG grants permission for Astellas to deviate from compliance, should such non-compliance be necessary to avoid breaching the terms of their License Agreement with Imigen, Inc., signed on October 30, 2003, concerning HIF stabilization technology. Furthermore, Astellas is not bound to comply with any future Third Party Agreements acquired through an FG license under Section 14.5.1 hereof, unless explicit written consent is provided by Astellas stating their intention to fulfill the agreement's requirements.

original: ARTICLE 15 REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 15.1 FG Warranties . FG warrants and represents to Astellas, as of the execution of this Agreement, that (i) it is a corporation duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware; (ii) the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on the part of FG; (iii) there is no pending litigation which alleges or any communication alleging that Commercialization of any Lead Compound or any compound Controlled by FG for use in the Field has infringed or misappropriated the intellectual property rights of any Third Party or has been obtained by misappropriating any Third Party’s intellectual property right; and (iv) subject to the terms and conditions of the agreements for the FG Acquired Patents, FG has complete title to and ownership of the FG Patents, free and clear from any mortgages, pledges, liens, security interests, conditional and installment sale agreements, encumbrances, charges or claims of any kind.
modified:
ARTICLE 15 REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

15.1 Warranties by Astellas. Astellas warrants and represents to FG, as of the effective date of this Agreement, that (i) it is a corporation duly incorporated, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction; (ii) the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on Astellas' part; (iii) there are no pending or threatened legal actions that allege, or any communication that suggests, that the Commercialization of any Lead Compound or any compound Controlled by Astellas for use in the Field has infringed or misappropriated the intellectual property rights of a Third Party, or has been obtained through the misappropriation of a Third Party's intellectual property; (iv) subject to the terms and conditions of the agreements governing the Astellas Acquired Patents, Astellas has good faith belief that it holds clear title to and ownership of the Astellas Patents, but acknowledges and agrees that any potential disputes regarding title or ownership will be resolved between the parties through mutual discussions, and if necessary, by third-party arbitration, at the expense of the party found to have invalid claims; (v) Astellas is not bound by any obligations, express or implied, to any Third Party that would conflict with its rights and obligations under this Agreement.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility for potential disputes regarding title or ownership of patents from FG to both parties, and clarifies that Astellas may have obligations to third parties that could potentially conflict with its obligations under the agreement.

original: ARTICLE 16 CONFIDENTIALITY 16.1 Confidential Information . Except as expressly provided herein, the parties agree that the receiving party shall not publish or otherwise disclose and shall not use for any purpose other than this Agreement any information furnished to it by the other party hereto pursuant to this Agreement which if disclosed in tangible form is marked “Confidential” or with other similar designation to indicate its confidential or proprietary nature or if disclosed orally is indicated orally to be confidential or proprietary by the party disclosing such information at the time of such disclosure and is confirmed in writing as confidential or proprietary by the disclosing party within a reasonable time after such disclosure (collectively, “Confidential Information”). Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information shall not include information that, in each case is demonstrated by written documentation:
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 16 CONFIDENTIALITY

16.1 Definition of Confidential Information: The parties acknowledge and agree that the disclosing party retains all rights to any information shared between them under this Agreement, except as explicitly specified herein. The receiving party shall not disseminate or exploit such information for any purpose beyond this Agreement without prior written consent from the disclosing party. This restriction applies to any information, whether in tangible form labeled "Confidential" or otherwise identified orally as confidential or proprietary at the time of disclosure by the disclosing party and later confirmed in writing within a reasonable timeframe (collectively, "Confidential Information"). However, this obligation does not extend to information that is proven through written documentation to be publicly available, generally known within the industry, or independently developed by the receiving party without reference to the Confidential Information.

In this revised version, the original clause placed an obligation on the receiving party not to disclose confidential information unless it was marked as such or orally indicated as confidential. The rewritten clause shifts the responsibility to the receiving party to demonstrate that the confidential information is publicly available, generally known within the industry, or independently developed, thus weakening the initial obligation of non-disclosure.

original: (a) was already known to the receiving party, other than under an obligation of confidentiality directly or indirectly to the disclosing party at the time of disclosure hereunder; (b) was generally available to the public or otherwise part of the public domain at the time of its disclosure to the receiving party hereunder; (c) became generally available to the public or otherwise part of the public domain after its disclosure and other than through any act or omission of the receiving party in breach of this Agreement; or (d) was subsequently lawfully disclosed to the receiving party by any third party without any confidentiality obligation directly or indirectly to the disclosing party or developed by the receiving party without reference to any information or materials disclosed by the disclosing party.
ollama_generated:
(a) The information was, at the time of its receipt under this Agreement, either previously known to the receiving party without any confidentiality obligation to the disclosing party; or had been publicly available or part of the public domain, regardless of any such obligations.

(b) Alternatively, the information was not subject to any confidentiality obligations at the time it was disclosed and became generally accessible to the public or entered the public domain subsequently, excluding any instance where this occurred due to a breach of this Agreement by the receiving party.

(c) Moreover, any subsequent disclosure of similar information to the receiving party by any third party was made without any confidentiality obligation to the disclosing party and independent of any information or materials disclosed hereunder.

(d) Lastly, if the receiving party developed such information on its own, it did so without referencing any information or materials provided by the disclosing party under this Agreement.

modified: DISCRETIONARY   EXECUTION COPY authorities (including regulatory authorities), or conducting clinical trials hereunder with respect to Lead Compounds, unless a party is expressly compelled by law to make such disclosure of the other party’s Confidential Information. However, no obligation shall arise from this provision to seek or obtain confidential treatment prior to the disclosure.

original: CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY 17.3 Indemnification of Astellas . FG shall indemnify each of Astellas and its Affiliates and the directors, officers, and employees of Astellas and such Affiliates and the successors and assigns of any of the foregoing (the “Astellas Indemnitees”), and hold each Astellas Indemnitee harmless from and against any and all liabilities, damages, settlements, claims, actions, suits, penalties, fines, costs or expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys’ fees and other expenses of litigation) incurred by any Astellas Indemnitee to the extent not otherwise covered by insurance, arising from or occurring as a result of any claim, action, suit, or other proceeding brought by third parties against an Astellas Indemnitee to the extent caused by failure of the Lead Compound supplied by FG to meet the Product Specifications in effect at the time of manufacture, or material deviation by FG or its sub-contractor from GMP Guidelines in manufacturing the Lead Compound, except in each case in this Section 17.3 to the extent caused by Astellas’ breach of this Agreement or willful misconduct.
ollama_generated:
CONFIDENTIAL   EXECUTION COPY
17.3 Limitation on Astellas' Liability - FG assumes primary responsibility for indemnifying Astellas and its Affiliates, as well as their respective directors, officers, employees, successors, and assigns (the "Astellas Parties"). The indemnity provided herein will protect the Astellas Parties from any liabilities, damages, settlements, claims, actions, suits, penalties, fines, costs or expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees and other litigation expenses) arising from third-party claims due to: a) the Lead Compound supplied by FG not meeting Product Specifications at the time of manufacture; b) any deviation by FG or its subcontractors from GMP Guidelines in manufacturing the Lead Compound, subject to the following exceptions: i) instances where such issues are caused by Astellas' breach of this Agreement; ii) situations involving Astellas' willful misconduct. This indemnification is provided solely to the extent that such liabilities or damages are not already covered by insurance.

original: 17.4 Procedure . A party (for purposes of this Section 17.4, the “Indemnitee”) that intends to claim indemnification under any provision of this Agreement shall promptly notify the indemnifying party (the “Indemnitor”) in writing of any claim, action, suit, or other proceeding brought by third parties in respect of which the Indemnitee or any of its Affiliates, or their directors, officers, employees, successors or assigns intend to claim such indemnification hereunder. As between the parties hereto the Indemnitor shall have the right to control the defense and settlement of such claim, action, suit, or other proceeding; provided, that the Indemnitee shall have the right to participate in such defense or settlement with counsel of its own choosing at its expense. The Indemnitee shall not make any settlement of any loss, claim, damage, liability or action without the consent of the Indemnitor, to the extent such consent is not withheld unreasonably or delayed. The failure to deliver written notice to the Indemnitor within a reasonable time after the commencement of any such action, if prejudicial to its ability to defend such action, shall relieve such Indemnitor of any liability to the Indemnitee under this Article 17 but the omission so to deliver written notice to the Indemnitor shall not relieve the Indemnitor of any liability that it may have to any Indemnitee otherwise than under this Article 17. Without limiting the foregoing, the Indemnitee shall keep the Indemnitor fully informed of the progress of any claim, action, suit, or other proceeding for which it intends to claim indemnification under this Article 17.
ollama_generated: 17.4 Procedure . Any party (hereafter referred to as the "Claimant") seeking indemnity under any provision of this Agreement is obligated to provide written notice to the other party (the "Indemnitor") within a reasonable time upon becoming aware of any claim, action, suit, or other proceeding brought by third parties in respect of which the Claimant or any of its Affiliates, or their directors, officers, employees, successors, or assigns may be entitled to indemnification. The Indemnitor shall have the sole discretion to decide on the defense and settlement strategy for such claim, action, suit, or other proceeding; however, the Claimant shall be permitted to participate in the defense or settlement process, at its own expense, with counsel of its choice. Any settlement made by the Claimant regarding any loss, claim, damage, liability, or action requires the prior written consent of the Indemnitor, unless such consent is unreasonably withheld or delayed. If the Claimant fails to provide written notice to the Indemnitor within a reasonable time after the commencement of any such action and this failure prejudices the Indemnitor's ability to defend the action, then the Indemnitor shall not be liable to the Claimant under this Article 17. However, the Claimant's failure to provide notice shall not absolve the Indemnitor of any liability it may have to the Claimant outside of this Article 17. The Claimant is responsible for keeping the Indemnitor fully apprised of the progress of any claim, action, suit, or other proceeding for which indemnification is sought under this Article 17.

original: 18.2.4 Development Diligence Failure . FG may terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days notice to Astellas in the event Astellas fails to meet any of its development diligence requirements as set forth in Article 11 hereof, provided, however, that with respect to the development diligence obligations set forth in Section 11.3.2, such termination right on behalf of FG shall be triggered only upon Astellas’ failure to meet such development diligence obligations for a Major Indication (except those Major Indications set forth in Section 11.3.1(iv)), and Astellas may terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days notice to FG in the event FG fails to meet the development diligence requirement as set forth in Section 11.2 hereof.
ollama_generated:
18.2.4 Failure of Development Diligence Obligation. Astellas retains the right, upon providing thirty (30) days notice to FG, to terminate this Agreement if FG fails to fulfill any of its development diligence obligations as detailed in Article 11 herein, except for the obligations specified in Section 11.2, for which Astellas' right to termination will not be triggered. Conversely, FG may only exercise its termination right with respect to Astellas' failure to meet the development diligence obligations related to Major Indications (excluding those listed in Section 11.3.1(iv)), and Astellas, upon providing thirty (30) days notice to FG, may terminate this Agreement if FG fails to adhere to the development diligence requirement set forth in Section 11.3.2 for such Major Indications.

This revised clause places a stronger emphasis on Astellas' ability to terminate the agreement if FG fails to meet its development diligence obligations, while limiting FG's termination right solely to instances where Astellas does not meet its obligations for certain Major Indications.

original: 18.2.5 Other Material Non-Performance/Misrepresentation . Other than a breach giving rise to a termination right as set forth in Sections 18.2.1 or 18.2.4, or a termination pursuant to a Technical Product Failure as set forth in Section 18.2.3 in the event of (i) a party’s breach or default in any other material respect in the performance or observance of any other material term, covenant or provision of this Agreement, or (ii) if any representation by a party contained in this Agreement shall prove to have been incorrect in any material respect when made, resulting in material adverse consequences for the other party, (any such default or material incorrect representation a “Material Non-Performance”), such Material Non-Performance shall be remedied only as provided in Section 18.7.4 below.
ollama_generated: 18.2.5 Misrepresentation and Significant Performance Failures: Except for instances outlined in Sections 18.2.1, 18.2.4, or 18.2.3 regarding Technical Product Failure upon a breach, default, or non-compliance with any essential term, agreement, or obligation under this contract (hereinafter referred to as "Significant Performance Failure"), which may lead to substantial harm for the other party, such failures will only be rectified in accordance with Section 18.7.4 below. The onus of rectification lies solely with the party causing the Significant Performance Failure.

original: 18.6 Termination upon Notice . Subject to Section 18.7.2, Astellas may terminate this Agreement upon six (6) months notice to FG for any reason or no reason.
modified: 18.6 Termination at Discretion of Astellas. With the exception of Section 18.7.2, FG acknowledges and agrees that Astellas has the discretion to terminate this Agreement at its sole discretion, with a notice period of six (6) months, without specifying any particular reason for such termination.

original: 18.7 Effect of Termination 18.7.1 Accrued Obligations . Termination of this Agreement for any reason shall not release either party hereto from any liability which, at the time of such termination, has already accrued to the other party or which is attributable to a period prior to such termination nor preclude either party from pursuing all rights and remedies it may have hereunder or at law or in equity with respect to any breach of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
18.7 Consequences of Termination
18.7.1 Accrued Responsibilities. The termination of this Agreement, regardless of the cause, shall not absolve either party from any obligations that have already been incurred by the other party or liabilities arising from a timeframe preceding such termination. Furthermore, it shall not prevent either party from exercising all rights and remedies available under this Agreement, as well as any legal or equitable actions related to any breach of this Agreement. In essence, the termination does not affect the parties' ability to seek redress for any pre-termination liabilities or post-termination breaches.

original: 19.2.2 Proceedings . Except as otherwise provided herein, the parties shall use their best efforts to complete the arbitration within [ * ] after the appointment of the Panel under Section 19.2.1 above, unless a party can demonstrate to the Panel that the complexity of the issues or other reasons warrant the extension of one or more of the time tables. In such case, the Panel may extend such time table as reasonably required.
ollama_generated: 19.2.2 Arbitration Timeline: Unless specified elsewhere within this agreement, the parties will make reasonable efforts to conclude the arbitration process no later than [ * ] following the panel's appointment under Section 19.2.1 above. If a party can demonstrate compelling reasons, such as the intricacy of the matters at hand or unforeseen circumstances, that necessitate additional time, the Panel may adjust the timeline accordingly, taking into account the necessities of all parties involved.

original: ARTICLE 20 MISCELLANEOUS 20.1 Confidential Terms . Except as expressly provided herein, each party agrees not to disclose any terms of this Agreement to any third party without the consent of the other party, except (i) as required by securities or other applicable laws or (ii) to prospective and other investors and such party’s accountants, attorneys and other professional advisors, or (iii) to others under reasonable conditions of confidentiality.
